title: What is the standard form of a circle that has a center of (4,0) and a radius of 5? - Quora

response.answer_text: If centre of circle (h,k) & radius =r , it’s equation is (x-h)^2+(y-k)^2= r^2 , with the given information plugging in h =4 , k = 0 & r= 5 , the required eqn. of the circle , (x-4)^2+(y-0)^2 = 5^2
